description.narrative: Generally, exploration projects have limited development impact but even at this early stage, the proposed investment has shown tangible benefits to the surrounding communities by generating local employment for people in poor parts of western Colombia. The project is also expected to help underline the imporatnce of invigorating the mining sector in Colombia. Expected development impacts during the production phase will include: (i) Local economic develoment in a poor part of Colombia through the generation of direct and indirect employment opportunities. (ii) Fiscal receipts in the form of taxes, royalties, foreign exchange and diversification of the domestic economy. (iii) Community investment programs / possible AS interventions.

The El Dovio project (El Dovio or the project) is a very early exploration stage project located in western Colombia between the municipalities of El Dovi and Sipi. The Project combines five exploration licenses registered in the name of Corporacion Minera de Colombia (CMC), a wholly owned subsidiary of Colombian Mines. To date, Colombian Mines has invested around US$2.5 million in exploration activities at El Dovio, including geochemical and geophysical surveys, trenching and channel sampling. The Company also recently initiated a phase I drilling program, which consisted of 1,500 meters (10 drill holes). Initial assay results have produced high grade copper and gold intercepts, including 6.9 meters at 5.9 g/t gold and 5.9% copper. It is anticipated that an initial mineral resource could be prepared by mid-2014, with a Preliminary Economic Assessment (PEA) by quarter 4 of 2014.

name.narrative: El Dovio is located on a ridge between the municipalities of El Dovio (Department of Valle del Cauca) and Sipi (Department of Choco) in western Colombia. It can be access from the town of El Dovio via a 50km gravel road to the town of Lituania. From Lituania, the site is accessible by an 8km pioneered dirt road/trail.
